data.title: Terminal not scrolling to current line when reopening

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 Insider
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open terminal and run a script that keeps generate output
2. Hide terminal
3. Reopen terminal. It's not scrolling to the newest content.
4. Press enter. Now it's showing the newest content.

![terminal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/19096346/8b940d1a-8a50-11e6-8372-5e3063122f67.gif)

data.title: Return key is ignored a couple of times before being accepted.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 (insider preview build 14939)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open C document
2. switch away from VSCode, wait a few seconds
3. switch back to VSCode
4. press return/enter key and no new line is started, keep pressing until new line appears, then works normally until switching away again.

data.title: Add user setting to swap sides for the diffEditor when viewing git changes
data.body:
When viewing your local changes in the changes view / diff editor, the read-only HEAD is shown on the left and the local file on the right. This seems very unnatural to me, especially when editing the local file in this view. I want to see the local file on the left and the HEAD on the right for reference.

I propose adding a user setting to swap these panes, or a toggle/swap button `<->` between the panes. The settings option would be something like:

```
"diffEditor.localChangesOnLeft": true,
```

data.title: file associations documentation
data.body:
Please include a list of default file associations in the documentation

https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/userandworkspace

It took me forever to find `shellscript`
Tried `sh` `bash` `shell` 

```
"files.associations": {
    "*.fish": "shellscript"
}
```

data.title: Make the Explorer Level "Create File" and "Create Folder" available so that keybindings can be assigned
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win10

This is more of a feature request. In https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/fileActions.ts
line 600 there is a class called CreateFileAction. I have noticed this is used in the solution explorer class.

There is a public ID, but when trying to assign a keybinding to this action I get a warning.
http://puu.sh/rxN5l/673879404b.png

command "workbench.files.action.createFileFromExplorer" not found

Would it be possible to make it available?

data.title: Getting 404s for JSs and CSSs while debugging default website from Visual Studio Code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a directory
2. 'dotnet new -t Web' in the directory
3. 'dotnet restore' and 'dotnet run' in the directory
4. Load the website in a browser at http://localhost:5000/ and notice that everything loads and looks OK
5. Open Visual Studio Code and open the directory from step 1
6. Accept adding debugging assets and start debugging the website
7. The browser will load the site (at http://localhost:5000/) and notice that JS and CSS requests are getting 404s and the site looks bad.

I've recorded [a video with these steps](http://www.screencast.com/t/NvbuNGKCFZbX). Also I [cross-posted on Stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/q/39860484/1796).

data.title: Word Wrap disabled when saving a new file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make sure you have `"editor.wordWrap": false` set in your Settings
2. Create a new file (don't save it)
3. Write a line of text longer that the current window width
4. Toggle Word Wrap
5. Save the file
6. Word Wrap will be disabled

data.title: VS Code does not recognize git repo it did not create
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:40:08.699Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on git icon
2. Message "the repo is not under git control"
3. Notice it is not referencing the correct directory
4. created git repo at terminal, independent of VS Code
5. Same message "the repo is not under git control"
6. Close VS Code and reopen
7. Same message "the repo is not under git control"

data.title: A quality of life change: When opening an image in VSCode display dimensions
data.body: Not a big change, but it would be quite convenient to display image dimensions in the editor instead of having to look it up in an explorer/editor for those times when you forget!

data.title: Destructuring fails as first line of Node program but not otherwise
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5
- Node version: 6.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start in empty directory and add an index.js file as follows

```
const [foo, bar] = [1, 2]
```
1. Run the debugger (set up launch.json and continue)

```
(function (exports, require, module, __filename, __dirname) { const [foo, bar] = [1, 2];
                                                                     ^
TypeError: Cannot read property 'next' of undefined
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/jstitt/n/index.js:1:70)
    at Module._compile (module.js:556:32)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:565:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:473:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:432:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:424:3)
    at Timeout.Module.runMain [as _onTimeout] (module.js:590:10)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:232:11)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:202:5)
```
1. Run index.js from command line with node. Error does not occur.
2. Add a line before this (e.g. `console.log('hello')` and re-run. Error does not occur in either VSCode Debug or command line node.

data.title: Fit watermark into code org (fixes #13069)
data.body: Ben, could you take a quick look? One issue is that the contribution is instantiated before the editor part's container element is created, so I wait for `partService.joinCreation()`, but that's already a little late.

data.title: UX meeting agenda 5th October 2016
Add Electron support for theming MacOS titlebar
data.body:
Latest versions of Atom added the ability to theme or hide the MacOS titlebar, which apparently is due to the ability being added to latest versions of the Electron shell.

![screen shot 2016-10-04 at 11 42 59 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/19081286/c0a29ad6-8a27-11e6-8261-ca44ad50a5f5.jpg)

data.title: Feature-request for a gutter display option.
data.body:
With everything gutter-related turned off (line numbers, code folding, etc.) there's still significant padding between the code and the edge of the editor: http://imgur.com/MT41OKD

Sublime Text has an option to completely hide the gutter leaving only a few pixels of padding: http://imgur.com/a/1Dsp3

So, an `"editor.gutter": true/false` option that mimics Sublime Text would be great.

data.title: Test: breakpoint hit count
data.body:
# Test for #12374 and #12373: Complexity: 2 - [x] any OS - **@bpasero** - [x] any OS - **@egamma** We now support specifying a hit count for a breakpoint - thus a breakpoint will only be hit if a debug-adapter specific hit count condition is met. More details: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12373 Have a node workspace and verify: - You can edit an existing or new breakpoint to specify the hit condition - You can add an existing or new **conditional** breakpoint to specify the hit condition - Breakpoint with a hit count is only hit if the 'hit count expression' is met. The syntax for node-debug is:
`(>|>=|=|<|<=|%)?\s*([0-9]+)` Examples: - `>10`break after 10 hits - `<3` break on the first two hits - `10` same as `>= 10` - `% 2` break on every other hit

data.title: Inconsistent Autoformatting Behavior
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. **[Edit]** File > Preferences > User Settings
2. **[Set]** "javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBrackets": true
3. **[Ensure]** There is no workspace settings file interfering 
4. **[Create]** test.js
5. **[Add]** `var x = ['foo', 'bar'];`
6. **[Observe]** Upon hitting the semi-colon key, the line will be formatted as such:
   `var x = [ 'foo', 'bar' ];` as expected
7. **[Auto-Format]** Trigger an auto-format ensuring nothing is highlighted (shift + alt + f)
8. **[Observe]** The line will be formatted back to: `var x = ['foo', 'bar'];`
9. **[Select-All]** 
10. **[Auto-Format]**
11. **[Observe]** The line will be reformatted to the correct: `var x = [ 'foo', 'bar' ];` again

data.title: VS Code froze when processing project the first time
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:40:08.699Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.13.0-24-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. have a big project (many files and folders with c, c++, perl, bash, python, yml, makefile, etc )
2. installed vcode-todo
3. restarted

After it opened, it froze for a least 40m (with RED linux emblem in the right  bottom corner, assuming that means it's working like hell). Shouldn't it run without  affecting the program !? Same happened the first time I opened a big project with VSCode, assuming it was processing and storing the functions and all.

Format a file on save. A formatter must be available, the file must not be auto-saved, and editor must not be shutting down.

".resx", 0; "formatOnSave"

Is "Format a file on save" a command/action or just a description to be understood as "It formats a file on save"? Thanks.  Zinacle 10/4/2016 11:22:15 AM

data.title: Show release notes automatically after an install @joaomoreno
Enable select all with RegEx patterns

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Find strings with RegEx pattern `h\d`
   - this will highlight `h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6`
2. Now i want to select all the matches `Ctrl+Shift+L`

**Expected:** close the find dialog and select all the matches

**Note:** This will work with non RegEx pattern!

data.title: Unable to view entire error message in top drop down error bar
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.5.3 - OS Version: macOS Sierre v 10.12 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Load any process that will create a error message to display in the top drop down error bar on either a reduced window size or with a long file path error. 2. Unable to view or scroll through whole message, so unsure what the end of the message is (even with debug console open, the error messages do not display in the debug console, which i wouldn't expect them to, but thought it was worth mentioning).
